alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:06PM EST until February 19 at 6:07AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. Blanchard River Near Findlay affecting Hancock County. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandusky River...including Tiffin...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blanchard River...including Findlay...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blanchard River Near Findlay. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Several businesses impacted downtown, with many roads near the river closed. County Road 236 to State Route 568 inundated. The following streets are likely to be flooded, Main Cross Street from Western to Township Road 180, Broad Street, streets along Eagle Creek from Central to Rockside and streets along Lye Creek from Wedgewood to Strong Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 15.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 06/02/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM EST.
